contentrichtext.text: {{prose|date=March 2013}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} * According to ''[[Hervarar saga]]'', '''Refil''' was a son of the [[Sweden|Swedish]] king [[Björn Ironside]] and the brother of its next king [[Erik Björnsson]]. He appears in ''[[Hervarar saga]]'' and in ''[[Nafnaþulur]]''. According to these sources, Refil was a great warlord and a [[sea-king]] who would have lived in the early 9th century. It was Refil's son [[Erik Refilsson]] who inherited the Swedish throne upon Erik Björnsson's death, which suggests that Refil may not have been alive at the time. * According to ''[[Skáldskaparmál]]'', '''Refil''' is also the name of the sword of [[Regin]], brother of [[Fafnir]]. [[Category:Artifacts in Norse mythology]] [[Category:Semi-legendary kings of Sweden]] [[Category:Viking warriors]] [[Category:House of Munsö]] {{Notstub}}
